result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn William Watkins

defendant.name: Watkins, Glenn William

records.addlTxt: 10:39 AM Defendant Glenn William Watkins in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Notice of right to attorney given to Defendant. Bond already set and is to continue. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 08/18/2022 at 9:00 AM
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): N.A.C, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office OR with the Price County Sheriff's Dept. outside of normal business hours.  
*No contact includes:  going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located.  Contact through means of telephone, electronic devices, social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party is prohibited.  The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.  

DEF is not to go upon the property or residence of the victim (N.A.C.)

DEF is not to possess firearms.

2:47PM DEF Glenn W. Watkins appeared via video from in custody from Price County Jail.  Atty K. Kelz appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case, recites appearances, and possible charges stated.  Court gives DEF notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.   State makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond.  Court sets INIT for 7/5/22 at 10AM.  

COURT:  CBS $1000 Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): N.A.C, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office OR with the Price County Sheriff's Dept. outside of normal business hours.  
*No contact includes:  going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located.  Contact through means of telephone, electronic devices, social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party is prohibited.  The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.  

DEF is not to go upon the property or residence of the victim (N.A.C.)

DEF is not to possess firearms.
